Uses of Class
prism.Point

  • Packages that use Point 
    Package Description
    prism
    The main Prism API, the command-line tool, and Java classes for symbolic data structures and algorithms.

    • Uses of Point in prism

      Fields in prism with type parameters of type Point 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.ArrayList<Point> Tile.cornerPoints
      The corner points that determine this Tile
      Methods in prism that return Point 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Point Point.clone()
      Returns a point with the same coordinates as this point.
      Point TileList.getCandidateHyperplane()
      Returns a weight vector which could yield a new Pareto point when used.
      private Point TileList.getFreshRealCandidateHyperplane()
      Queries the tiles of this TileList to get a new weight vector which could yield a new pareto point when used.
      protected static Point MultiObjUtils.getNewTarget(java.util.List<Point> computedPoints, java.util.List<Point> directions, double errorTolerance, double[] maxValues)
      Returns new point for computation of two dimensional pareto curve.
      static Point MultiObjUtils.getWeights(Point point, java.util.List<Point> computedPoints)
      Returns a point that represents a hyperplane that separates point from computedPoints.
      protected static Point Tile.getWeightsForTile(Tile t)
      Gets a weight vector representing the hyperplane given by the tile.
      Point Point.normalize()
      Returns the point in which the coordinates are reweighted so that the norm of the point is equal to 1.
      Point Point.project(java.util.BitSet b)
      Returns the point obtained from the current one by projecting it to the dimensions specified by b.
      Point Point.toRealProperties(OpsAndBoundsList obl)
      This methods ensures that the point's values corresponds to the properties the user did input.
      Methods in prism that return types with arguments of type Point 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected static java.util.Map<Point,Point> MultiObjUtils.fillDirections(java.util.List<Point> computedPoints, java.util.List<Point> directions, boolean horiz)
      This method takes a list of computed points together with their associated directions, where points are possibly repeated, and returns a map in which to each point from computedPoints corresponds the associated direction from directions which has the most extreme slope.
      protected static java.util.Map<Point,Point> MultiObjUtils.fillDirections(java.util.List<Point> computedPoints, java.util.List<Point> directions, boolean horiz)
      This method takes a list of computed points together with their associated directions, where points are possibly repeated, and returns a map in which to each point from computedPoints corresponds the associated direction from directions which has the most extreme slope.
      java.util.ArrayList<Point> Tile.getCornerPoints()
      Returns a list containing the corner points representing this tile.
      java.util.List<Point> TileList.getPoints()
      Returns the points that form the tiles of this TileList.
      java.util.List<Point> TileList.getPointsWithoutCovered()
      Returns the points that form the tiles of this TileList, omitting the points that are covered by other points.
      java.util.List<Point> TileList.getRealPoints()
      Returns the points that form the actual Pareto curve (modifying the points from tiles according to the operator bound changes).
      protected static java.util.List<Point> MultiObjUtils.removeDuplicities(java.util.List<Point> list)
      This method takes a list of points and returns a sub-list in which points that are very close to each other (where isCloseTo(Point) is used to determine what is "very close") are removed.
      protected static java.util.List<Point> MultiObjUtils.upperBoundPoints(java.util.List<Point> computedPoints, java.util.List<Point> directions)
      This method takes the set of some corner points of a pareto curve computedPoints together with associated orthogonal lines directions that determine current over-approximation, and returns the points which determine the over-approximation.
      Methods in prism with parameters of type Point 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void TileList.addNewPoint(Point point)
      Adds a newly discovered point to this TileList.
      int PermutedLexicographicComparator.compare(Point o1, Point o2) 
      protected int PermutedLexicographicComparator.compare(Point o1, Point o2, int i)
      Compares two points, starting with the coordinate with the i-th highest priority.
      double Point.distanceTo(Point p)
      Returns the Euclidean distance from this point to p
      static Point MultiObjUtils.getWeights(Point point, java.util.List<Point> computedPoints)
      Returns a point that represents a hyperplane that separates point from computedPoints.
      boolean Point.isCloseTo(Point p)
      Determines if this point is very close to the point p, where two points are very close if all of their coordinated differ at most by SMALL_NUMBER.
      boolean Point.isCoveredBy(Point p)
      Determines if this point is pointwise smaller than p+SMALL_NUMBER.
      protected boolean Tile.pointAboveHyperplane(Point point)
      Returns true if point lies strictly above the hyperplane given by this tile.
      static void MultiObjUtils.printGraphFileDebug(Point target, java.util.List<Point> points, java.util.List<Point> directions, java.lang.String directory, int index)
      Prints an auxiliary graph file in gnuplot format.
      boolean Tile.processNewPoint(Point point, boolean updateUpperBounds, int upperBoundsIndex)
      Returns true if this tile will be changed when point is added to a parent TileList.
      java.util.List<Tile> Tile.splitByPoint(Point point, java.util.List<Point> otherPoints, double tolerance)
      Returns a list of tiles that should be added to the parent TileList when point is added, replacing the current tile.
      protected void TileList.splitTilesByPoint(Point point, boolean isRealyFoundPoint)
      Splits the Tiles using the new point.
